newsitem.title: UK: Eurotunnel Jan cars lower, Eurostar gains.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel Jan cars lower, Eurostar gains.

text.p: Anglo-French channel tunnel operator Eurotunnel SA/Plc said on Thursday that in January, when its freight shuttle operations stayed suspended due to last year's fire, the volume of cars carried fell while the volume of passengers on Eurostar-operated trains rose.
In its monthly traffic data, the company said its Le Shuttle tourist service carried 83,534 cars and 1,105 coaches compared with 96,971 cars and 1,799 coaches in the same year-ago month.
Eurostar passenger volume, boosted by the greater number of the trains now using the tunnel for inter-city journeys between London and Paris and Brussels, rose to 307,954 from 275,809.
Eurostar trains are operated by French and Belgian national railways and in Britain by EPS, a consortium which includes National Express Group Plc and the Virgin group.
As long as Eurotunnel's freight shuttle remains closed the ferry lines which compete with the fixed link are able to take up the slack in the market.
In its comparative data, Eurotunnel noted that in January 1996 it carried 45,763 trucks comared with none this year.
Separately, the volume of bulk train-borne freight carried through the tunnel by other rail operators rose slightly to 185,067 tonnes in the month from 165,857 tonnes a year ago.
